item.title: Danvers add a quote by Denis Leary
item.description: "Most people think life sucks, and then you die. Not me. I beg to differ. I think life sucks, then you get cancer, then your dog dies, your wife leaves you, the cancer goes into remission, you get a new dog, you get remarried, you owe ten million dollars in medical bills but you work hard for thirty five years and you pay it back and then one day you have a massive stroke, your whole right side is paralyzed, you have to limp along the streets and speak out of the left side of your mouth and drool but you go into rehabilitation and regain the power to walk and the power to talk and then one day you step off a curb at Sixty-seventh Street, and BANG you get hit by a city bus and then you die. Maybe" -- Denis Leary

item.title: Danvers add a quote by Wodehouse
Danvers add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Danvers add a quote by Tana French
item.description: "I am not good at noticing when I'm happy, except in retrospect." -- Tana French

item.title: Danvers add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "The covers of this book are too far apart." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Danvers add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Danvers add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You don't have to stay anywhere forever." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Danvers add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "Things are tough all over, cupcake, an' it rains on the just an' the unjust alike...except in California." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Danvers add a quote by Dennis Lehane
item.description: "In Greek tragedy, they fall from great heights. In noir, they fall from the curb." -- Dennis Lehane
